de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.filterable

Interface FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>

  • Type Parameters:
    GroupType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's group items
    ChildType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's child items
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractExpandableListAdapter, AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSelectableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter, ExpandableListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation

    public interface FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a filterable list of arbitrary group and child items, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a ExpandableListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFilterListener(ExpandableListFilterListener<GroupType,ChildType> listener)
      Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been filtered.
      boolean applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroup, GroupType group, java.lang.String query, int flags)
      Filters the child items of a specific group, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet.
      boolean applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroup, GroupType group, java.lang.String query, int flags, Filter<ChildType> filter)
      Filters the child items of a specific group by using a specific query and a filter, which is used to apply the query on the single child items, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet.
      boolean applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroup, int groupIndex, java.lang.String query, int flags)
      Filters the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet.
      boolean applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroup, int groupIndex, java.lang.String query, int flags, Filter<ChildType> filter)
      Filters the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, by using a specific query and a filter, which is used to apply the query on the single child items, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet.
      boolean applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroups, java.lang.String query, int flags)
      Filters the adapter's child items, regardless of the group they belong to, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet.

      Filters the adapter's child items, regardless of the group they belong to, by using a specific query and a filter, which is used to apply the query on the single child items, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet.

      Filters the child items of a specific group, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet.

      Filters the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet.

      boolean isFiltered()
      Returns, whether at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter to filter its group or child items, or not.
      boolean isGroupFilterApplied(java.lang.String query, int flags)
      Returns, whether a filter, which uses a specific query, is currently applied on the adapter's group items.
      void removeFilterListener(ExpandableListFilterListener<GroupType,ChildType> listener)
      Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been filtered, anymore.
      void resetAllChildFilters()
      Resets all applied filters, which have been applied on the adapter's child items, regardless of the groups they belong to.

      Resets all applied filters, which have been applied on the adapter's group items.

      Resets the filter, which has been applied on a group to filter its child items, which uses a specific query.

      Resets the filter, which has been applied on the adapter to filter its group items, which uses a specific query.

    • Method Detail

      • isFiltered

        boolean isFiltered()
        Returns, whether at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter to filter its group or child items, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter to filter its group or child items, false otherwise.

      • applyGroupFilter

        boolean applyGroupFilter(java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Filters the adapter's group items by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. If the underlying data of the adapter's group items does not implement the interface Filterable a FilteringNotSupportedException will be thrown. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered group item to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the group items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the group items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied, false otherwise

      • applyGroupFilter

        boolean applyGroupFilter(java.lang.String query,
                         int flags,
                         Filter<GroupType> filter)
        Filters the adapter's group items by using a specific query and a filter, which is used to apply the query on the single group items, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered group items to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the group items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the group items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        filter - The filter, which should be used to apply the given query on the adapter's group items, as an instance of the type Filter. The filter may not be null
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied, false otherwise

      • resetGroupFilter

        boolean resetGroupFilter(java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Resets the filter, which has been applied on the adapter to filter its group items, which uses a specific query.
        Parameters:
        query - The query of the filter, which should be reseted, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags of the filter, which should be reseted, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been reseted, false otherwise

      • resetAllGroupFilters

        void resetAllGroupFilters()
        Resets all applied filters, which have been applied on the adapter's group items.

      • isGroupFilterApplied

        boolean isGroupFilterApplied(java.lang.String query,
                             int flags)
        Returns, whether a filter, which uses a specific query, is currently applied on the adapter's group items.
        Parameters:
        query - The query of the filter, which should be checked, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags of the filter, which should be checked, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        True, if a filter, which uses the given query, is currently applied on the adapter's group items, false otherwise

      • areGroupsFiltered

        boolean areGroupsFiltered()
        Returns, whether at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter to filter its group items, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter to filter its group items, false otherwise.

      • getGroupFilterQueries

        java.util.Set<? extends FilterQuery> getGroupFilterQueries()
        Returns a set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter the adapter's group items.
        Returns:
        A set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter the adapter's group items, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no filters are currently applied on the adapter's group items

      • applyChildFilter

        boolean applyChildFilter(java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Filters the adapter's child items, regardless of the group they belong to, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Filterable a FilteringNotSupportedException will be thrown. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child item to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied on all groups, false otherwise

      • applyChildFilter

        boolean applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroups,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Filters the adapter's child items, regardless of the group they belong to, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Filterable a FilteringNotSupportedException will be thrown. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child item to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        filterEmptyGroups - True, if groups, which become empty by filtering their children, should be filtered as well, false otherwise
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied on all groups, false otherwise

      • applyChildFilter

        boolean applyChildFilter(GroupType group,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Filters the child items of a specific group, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Filterable a FilteringNotSupportedException will be thrown. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child item to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child items, which should be filtered, belong to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied, false otherwise

      • applyChildFilter

        boolean applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroup,
                         GroupType group,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Filters the child items of a specific group, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Filterable a FilteringNotSupportedException will be thrown. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child item to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        filterEmptyGroup - True, if the given group should be filtered as well, if it becomes empty by filtering its children, false otherwise
        group - The group, the child items, which should be filtered, belong to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied, false otherwise

      • applyChildFilter

        boolean applyChildFilter(int groupIndex,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Filters the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Filterable a FilteringNotSupportedException will be thrown. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child item to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child items, which should be filtered, belong to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied, false otherwise

      • applyChildFilter

        boolean applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroup,
                         int groupIndex,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Filters the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, by using a specific query, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Filterable a FilteringNotSupportedException will be thrown. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child item to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        filterEmptyGroup - True, if the given group should be filtered as well, if it becomes empty by filtering its children, false otherwise
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child items, which should be filtered, belong to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied, false otherwise

      • applyChildFilter

        boolean applyChildFilter(java.lang.String query,
                         int flags,
                         Filter<ChildType> filter)
        Filters the adapter's child items, regardless of the group they belong to, by using a specific query and a filter, which is used to apply the query on the single child items, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child items to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        filter - The filter, which should be used to apply the given query on the adapter's child items, as an instance of the type Filter. The filter may not be null
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied, false otherwise

      • applyChildFilter

        boolean applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroup,
                         GroupType group,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         int flags,
                         Filter<ChildType> filter)
        Filters the child items of a specific group by using a specific query and a filter, which is used to apply the query on the single child items, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child items to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        filterEmptyGroup - True, if the given group should be filtered as well, if it becomes empty by filtering its children, false otherwise
        group - The group, the child items, which should be filtered, belong to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used

      • applyChildFilter

        boolean applyChildFilter(int groupIndex,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         int flags,
                         Filter<ChildType> filter)
        Filters the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, by using a specific query and a filter, which is used to apply the query on the single child items, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child items to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child items, which should be filtered, belong to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        filter - The filter, which should be used to apply the given query on the group's child items, as an instance of the type Filter. The filter may not be null
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied, false otherwise

      • applyChildFilter

        boolean applyChildFilter(boolean filterEmptyGroup,
                         int groupIndex,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         int flags,
                         Filter<ChildType> filter)
        Filters the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, by using a specific query and a filter, which is used to apply the query on the single child items, if no filter using the same query has been applied yet. This method can be called multiple times without resetting the filtering, which causes the filtered child items to be filtered once more.
        Parameters:
        filterEmptyGroup - True, if the given group should be filtered as well, if it becomes empty by filtering its children, false otherwise
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child items, which should be filtered, belong to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        query - The query, which should be used to filter the child items, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which should be used to filter the child items, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags should be used
        filter - The filter, which should be used to apply the given query on the group's child items, as an instance of the type Filter. The filter may not be null
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been applied, false otherwise

      • resetChildFilter

        boolean resetChildFilter(java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Resets the filter, which has been applied on the adapter to filter its child items, regardless of the group they belong to, which uses a specific query.
        Parameters:
        query - The query of the filter, which should be reseted, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags of the filter, which should be reseted, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been reseted at all groups, false otherwise

      • resetChildFilter

        boolean resetChildFilter(GroupType group,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Resets the filter, which has been applied on a group to filter its child items, which uses a specific query.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child items, which have been filtered, belong to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        query - The query of the filter, which should be reseted, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags of the filter, which should be reseted, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been reseted, false otherwise

      • resetChildFilter

        boolean resetChildFilter(int groupIndex,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         int flags)
        Resets the filter, which has been applied on the group, which belongs to a specific index, to filter its child items, which uses a specific query.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child items, which have been filtered, belong to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        query - The query of the filter, which should be reseted, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags of the filter, which should be reseted, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        True, if the filter has been reseted, false otherwise

      • resetAllChildFilters

        void resetAllChildFilters()
        Resets all applied filters, which have been applied on the adapter's child items, regardless of the groups they belong to.

      • resetAllChildFilters

        void resetAllChildFilters(GroupType group)
        Resets all applied filters, which have been applied on the child items of a specific group.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child items, which have been filtered, belong to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown

      • resetAllChildFilters

        void resetAllChildFilters(int groupIndex)
        Resets all applied filters, which have been applied on the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child items, which have been filtered, belong to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • isChildFilterApplied

        boolean isChildFilterApplied(java.lang.String query,
                             int flags)
        Returns, whether at least one filter, which uses a specific query, is currently applied on the adapter to filter any of its items, or not.
        Parameters:
        query - The query of the filter, which should be checked, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags of the filter, which should be checked, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        True, if a filter, which uses the given query, is currently applied on the adapter to filter any of its child items, false otherwise

      • areChildrenFiltered

        boolean areChildrenFiltered()
        Returns, whether at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter to filter any of its child items, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if at least one filter is currently applied on the adapter to filter any of its child items, false otherwise.

      • isChildFilterApplied

        boolean isChildFilterApplied(GroupType group,
                             java.lang.String query,
                             int flags)
        Returns, whether a filter, which uses a specific query, is currently applied on a specific group's child items.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the filter, which should be checked, has been applied on, as instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        query - The query of the filter, which should be checked, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags of the filter, which should be checked, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        True, if a filter, which uses the given query, is currently applied on the given group's child items, false otherwise

      • isChildFilterApplied

        boolean isChildFilterApplied(int groupIndex,
                             java.lang.String query,
                             int flags)
        Returns, whether a filter, which uses a specific query, is currently applied on the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the filter, which should be checked, has been applied on, as Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        query - The query of the filter, which should be checked, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags of the filter, which should be checked, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        True, if a filter, which uses the given query, is currently applied on the given group's child items, false otherwise

      • getChildFilterQueries

        java.util.Set<? extends FilterQuery> getChildFilterQueries(int groupIndex)
        Returns a set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the queries, which should be returned, have been applied on, as Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        A set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter the child items, which belong to the given group, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no filters are currently applied on the child items of the given group

      • getChildFilterQueries

        java.util.Set<? extends FilterQuery> getChildFilterQueries(GroupType group)
        Returns a set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter the child items of a specific group.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the queries, which should be returned, have been applied on, as instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        A set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter the child items, which belong to the given group, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no filters are currently applied on the child items of the given group

      • getChildFilterQueries

        java.util.Set<? extends FilterQuery> getChildFilterQueries()
        Returns a set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter any of the adapter's child items.
        Returns:
        A set, which contains all queries, which are currently used to filter any of the adapter's child items, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no filters are currently applied on the adapter's child items

      • areChildrenFiltered

        boolean areChildrenFiltered(GroupType group)
        Returns, whether at least one filter is currently applied on a specific group to filter its child items, or not.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, whose filters should be checked, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if at least one filter is currently applied on the group to filter its child items, false otherwise

      • areChildrenFiltered

        boolean areChildrenFiltered(int groupIndex)
        Returns, whether at least one filter is currently applied on a specific group to filter its child items, or not.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, whose filters should be checked, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if at least one filter is currently applied on the group to filter its child items, false otherwise

      • addFilterListener

        void addFilterListener(ExpandableListFilterListener<GroupType,ChildType> listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been filtered.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the class ExpandableListFilterListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeFilterListener

        void removeFilterListener(ExpandableListFilterListener<GroupType,ChildType> listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been filtered, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the class ExpandableListFilterListener. The listener may not be null
